DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Metastasis Diameter Size Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An annotation to indicate the diameter of sentinel lymph node metastases measured.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes._The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor._The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.:The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._The physical magnitude of something._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Isolated Tumor Cells Less than 0.2 mm

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Isolated Tumor Cells Less than 0.2 mm
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cluster of metastatic malignant cells measuring less than 0.2 mm along the greatest dimension.

Concepts.longName: Isolated Tumor Cells Less than 0.2 mm
Concepts.definition: A cluster of metastatic malignant cells measuring less than 0.2 mm along the greatest dimension.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of a macrometastasis measuring more than 2 mm along the greatest dimension.

Concepts.definition: A finding of a macrometastasis measuring more than 2 mm along the greatest dimension.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of a micrometastasis measuring from 0. 2mm to 2 mm along the greatest dimension.

Concepts.definition: A finding of a micrometastasis measuring from 0. 2mm to 2 mm along the greatest dimension.

PermissibleValues.value: Greater than or equal to 1.0 cm but less than 1.5 cm

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater than or equal to 1.0 cm but less than 1.5 cm
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than or equal to 1.0 cm but less than 1.5 cm

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.:The physical magnitude of something.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
